q: How can I be sure the Koi I buy are healthy?
a: They are screened and treated for infections, parasites, and disease before sale.
Koi can grow to over 100 cm in optimal conditions. In average garden ponds most don’t exceed ~60 cm.

q: What determines the value of a Koi?
a: Value depends on bloodline/parentage, body shape, skin quality, pattern, size, and show potential. Also affected by rarity of variety.
Use good quality commercial foods. In cold weather feed lower protein (wheat germ), in warmer weather high protein and colour enhancing foods.

q: How deep / what size should a pond be?
a: At least 90 cm depth is recommended. Pond volume, filtration, and water quality significantly affect koi health.
Yes — but koi grow bigger, may dominate feeding, and can disturb plants.
Average lifespan is around 50 years; some are known to live beyond 100 years.

q: How should I transport Koi after purchase?
a: Use oxygenated packaging, multiple bags/boxes if needed, minimize stress, and acclimate gradually to your pond water.
